qas.question: Which term used in the Quran to indicate itself means "book"?
Which term does the Quran use to refer to itself as "scripture"?
What meaning does the Quran take when it calls itself hikmah?
What name does the Quran use for itself that means "revelation"?
Which term isn't used in the Quran to indicate itself means "book"?
Which term doesn't the Quran use to refer to itself as "scripture"?
Which term does the Quran use to refer to itself as "puncture"?
What meaning doesn't the Quran take when it calls itself hikmah?
What name doesn't the Quran use for itself that means "revelation"?

context: The term also has closely related synonyms that are employed throughout the Quran. Each synonym possesses its own distinct meaning, but its use may converge with that of qurʼān in certain contexts. Such terms include <a0_0><b4_0>kitāb<b4_0/><a0_0/> (book); āyah (sign); and <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>sūrah<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> (scripture). The latter two terms also denote units of revelation. In the large majority of contexts, usually with a definite article (al-), the word is referred to as the "revelation" (<a3_0><b8_0>waḥy<b8_0/><a3_0/>), that which has been "sent down" (tanzīl) at intervals. Other related words are: dhikr (remembrance), used to refer to the Quran in the sense of a reminder and warning, and ḥikmah (<a2_0><b7_0>wisdom<b7_0/><a2_0/>), sometimes referring to the revelation or part of it.
